title: Cops arrest Clifton teen who allegedly shot 16-year-old in leg
content:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. -- Police have caught the Clifton teen who was allegedly playing with a gun that accidentally discharged and hit a 16-year-old girl in the Park Hill Apartments last week.
Isaac Kingue-Noah, 17, waived the weapon in the air, causing it to discharge and strike the girl in the right knee while they were in a first-floor apartment on June 2 at 12:33 p.m., according to court documents.
The girl was treated for the gunshot wound in the leg and taken to Richmond University Medical Center, West Brighton, the criminal complaint says.
Kingue-Noah, of Vanderbilt Avenue, allegedly fled the scene after the incident and was sought for questioning.
He was arrested Thursday at the 120th Precinct stationhouse and charged with assault in the second degree, a felony, criminal possession of a firearm and reckless endangerment in the first degree, according to a spokesman for acting District Attorney Daniel Master.
